titleStmt.title: At Edinburgh, the 6. of October. 1648. VVhereas upon disbanding of the forces lately in arms, in and about Sterling great numbers of officers and souldiers, of that army, and others returned from England: do resort hither to the city of Edinburgh, and suburbs thereof, and commit divers disorders and insolencies, ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Parliament. Committee of Estates.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Evan Tyler, Printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
A proclamation that all who had been under arms should leave Edinburgh.
Imperfect: cropped and stained with some loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
